dict.acceptation: 发出隆隆声；快速发展；暴涨；
以低沉而有回响的声音发出；使繁荣；使迅速发展；

sent.orig: Boom! Boom! Boom! A series of explosions shook the valley.
sent.trans: 轰！轰！轰！一连串爆破声震撼山谷。

sent.orig: Mark ran itas he ran, the ground began to shake. BOOM, BOOM, BOOM, it went.
sent.trans: 马克追著飞盘跑，他一边跑，地面也开始震动，还发出了[隆、隆、隆]的声音。

sent.orig: DeficIt'spending created an economic boom and the boom laid the foundation for long-run prosperity.
sent.trans: 结果是：赤字开支创造了经济繁荣，并且为长期的繁荣打下了基础。

sent.orig: Many believe these delays fuelled the technology boom the 1990s and the later housing boom.
sent.trans: 许多人认为，当时美联储行动的延迟助长了90年代的科技繁荣和其后的楼市繁荣。

sent.orig: They turned the boom into a super-boom.
sent.trans: 降息使繁荣变成了超级繁荣。
